titleStmt.title: Musik til Helge Rodes skuespil "Moderen", opus 41

work.title: Musik til Helge Rodes skuespil "Moderen", opus 41
Music for Helge Rode's Play 'The Mother', Opus 41
Et eventyrspil i en prolog og syv billeder
A Play in a Prologue and Seven Scenes

history.p: To celebrate the reunion of South Jutland with Denmark in 1920, Helge Rode was commissioned to write the text. It appears that the author had Nielsen in mind as the composer at a very early stage; however, it was difficult to convince Nielsen to take on the task. Already from March and April, he was drafting the work though the earliest musical sources are dated May 1920. He was still composing in October, when he also began working on his fifth symphony (CNW 29).

expression.title: Brudstykker af de krigsførende Landes Nationalmelodier
Fragments of the National Anthems of the Belligerents
Version for voice and piano. Excerpts

history.p: A few months before the premiere of the play Moderen, Nielsen published extracts from the work in piano reduction, including eight songs and five instrumental pieces (Nos. 2, 4, 6, 8, 7, 9, 10, 11, 16, 15, 19, 1, 22 from the original version). Nielsen delivered the material to the publishers in December 1920, and the music was published in 1921.

titleStmt.title: Vocal score, partly autograph, fair copy (No. 20)

annot.p: Contains string and harp parts for the Danish national anthem Der er et yndigt land (melody by H.E. Krøyer). Apparently Nielsen intended to use the anthem in the play, but it is not included in any score.
